Ask HN: Optimal way to prepare for standardized exams? Can games help?
text:
Standardized exams are some mix of memorizing and problem solving.

For memorizing, spaced repetition comes to mind.

"Explain it out loud" can help with identifying gaps in understanding.

What other strategies do people use?

Can games help us digest new content? Any cool examples? (domain does not matter!)

What's the latest thinking on rapid/effective learning?

Ask HN: Managing a shared music library from several streaming services?
text:
I currently listen to music from many different sources. In addition to my local files, I also regularly use several streaming services, as well as YouTube, Bandcamp and so on.

Currently, each of these has an entirely different library with different favorites, playlists, etc, which makes it a little bit difficult to manage everything. I use iTunes for my local files, then Spotify has its own library of "liked" files, YouTube has its own playlists, SoundCloud has its own, and so on.

I would love for there to be some kind of simple app that lets me build a music library that incorporates all of these sources. I'm envisioning something kind of iTunes or Winamp-esque, except instead of the elements having to be files, they'd instead just be tokens that could point to a local file, or a remote HTTP URL, or a spotify: URI or a YouTube video or whatever. I would be able to put some kind of basic metadata on each one and organize things into artists, albums, and so on, as well as make playlists.

Does something exist that can do this? I feel like this could be a pretty simple web app, particularly if someone is willing to use e.g. FTP or Dropbox instead of a local file.

Ask HN: Any podcast app recommendations for marking points to return to?
text: I love to listen to podcasts while on long runs or while driving. As key/interesting points in the conversation come up I’d love to be able to flag them via Apple Watch or iPhone to come back to later. Overcast has an ability to share a link with a time stamp which is close to what I’m looking for, but what I’d really like is something like the highlight functionality of a kindle that stores personal list of highlights associated with a given book. Any recommendations?

Ask HN: What must I know to build a computer mouse?
text: There are tutorials out there but none list the essential skills necessary to build-it-yourself from scratch such as casting and molding. If there are pre-existing software or electronics out there to reduce effort, all the better. I see it as a hobby over a year or two. I have the idea and designs but no skills!
